question:
In light of BHEL commissioning the first lignite based thermal power unit, consider the following statements:
  1. Lignite is the highest grade of coal.
  2. Lignite has high carbon content.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: Lignite, which is also known as brown coal, is the lowest grade of coal. It is a type of sedimentary rock. It has lower heat content than the other grades of coal. Bituminous coal is of higher quality. Anthracite is the best grade of coal. Statement 2 is correct: Lignite has a very high content of carbon. 60% to 70% of the coal is carbon and it also has a higher concentration of moisture. BHEL has set up a lignite based thermal unit in Neyveli, Tamil Nadu with 500MW capacity.
